      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void setUp()
      Sets up the test fixture.
      Called before every test case method.
      Create one object, myTicketMachine, for each test
      void tearDown()
      Tears down the test fixture.
      Called after every test case method.
      Call the resetAll method, to reset all class attributes after each test
      void testAbort()
      Method testAbort: transaction aborted
      (1) insert 30 cents
      (2) abort
      [expected result] value for the balance -> 0
      void testChangePassword()
      Method testChangePassword: changing the password must be protected
      (1) wrong old password:
      - insert 50 cents
      - deliver a ticket
      [expected result] value of total 50
      - change password old="myPass", new="newPassword"
      - collect money with "newPassword"
      [expected result] value of total 50
      (2) new password with less thant 6 characters
      - change password old="myPassord", new="newP"
      - collect money with "newP"
      [expected result] value of total 50
      (3) right case: the user uses the right password
      - change password old="myPassord", new="newP"
      - collect money with "newP"
      [expected result] value of total 50
      void testCollectMoney()
      Method testCollectMoney: password protectino
      (1) wrong password:
      - insert 50 cents
      - deliver a ticket
      [expected result] value of total 50
      - collect money with "badPassword"
      [expected result] return value 0
      [expected result] value of total 50
      (2) right case: the user uses the right password
      - collect money with "newP"
      [expected result] return value 50
      [expected result] value of total 0
      void testDeliverTicket()
      Method testDeliverTicket: a ticket is delivered
      - correct case, insert 50 cents, one ticket is delivered
      [expected result] value of total 50
      [expected result] value of numberOfTickets 1
      [expected result] value of balance 0
      - correct case, insert 70 cents, one ticket is delivered
      [expected result] value of total 100
      [expected result] value of numberOfTickets 2
      [expected result] value of balance 20
      - wrong case, 30, not enough money, no ticket
      [expected result] value of total 100
      [expected result] value of numberOfTickets 2
      [expected result] value of balance 20
      void testGetBalance()
      Test of balance getter :
      (1) creates a new ticket machine whit ticket price value = 50 cents
      [expected result] value for the balance: 0
      void testGetNumberOfTickets()
      Test of numberOfTickets getter :
      (1) creates a new ticket machine whit ticket price value = 50 cents
      [expected result] value of numberOfTickets: 0
      void testGetPrice()
      Test of price getter :
      (1) creates a new ticket machine whit ticket price value = 50 cents
      [expected result] value for the price: 50
      void testGetTotal()
      Test of total getter :
      (1) creates a new ticket machine whit ticket price value = 50 cents
      [expected result] value of total: 0
      void testInsertMoney()
      Method testInsertMoney: test inserting money, right and wrong values
      (1) Correct amount, insert 30 cents
      [expected result] value of balance 30
      (2) Incorrect amount, insert -10 cents
      [expected result] value of balance 30
      (3) Incorrect amount, insert 0 cent
      [expected result] value of balance 30 (4) Correct amount, insert 40 cents
      [expected result] value of balance 70
      (5) Incorrect entry, insert 20 cents
      [expected result] value of balance 70
      (6) Incorrect sequence (refund not made) deliverTicket
      (7) insert 30 cents [expected result] value of balance 20
      void testNumberOfTickets()
      Method testNumberOfTickets: tickets are delivered with the right price
      [expected result] value of numberOfTickets 0
      [expected result] value of balance 0
      - wrong case, 20, not enough money, no ticket
      [expected result] value of numberOfTickets 1
      [expected result] value of balance 20
      - correct case, 100, one ticket and refund
      [expected result] value of numberOfTickets 1
      [expected result] value of balance 70
      - wrong case, deliver without refund
      [expected result] value of numberOfTickets 1
      [expected result] value of balance 70
      void testRefund()
      Method testRefund: refund the money and clears the balance
      (1) wrong case = no sale: insert 30 cents
      (2) refund
      [expected result] value for the balance -> 30
      (3) right case: insert 30 cents
      [expected result] value for the balance -> 60
      (4) right case, generates refund: deliverTicket
      [expected result] value for the balance -> 10
      (6) wrong case without refund: insert 30 cents
      [expected result] value for the balance -> 10
      (5) refund
      [expected result] value for the balance -> 0
      (6) insert 30 cents
      [expected result] value for the balance -> 30
      void testSetPrice()
      Test du setter de l'attribut price :
      (1) creates a new ticket machine with ticket price value = 50 cents
      (2) right password: sets the price to 20 cents with password "myPassword"
      [expected result] value of price: 20
      (3) wrong password: sets the price to 80 cents with password "badPassword"
      [expected result] value of price: 20
